Title: Randomised Controlled Trial on the Impact of a Reference Guide for Bariatric Surgery Nursing Care

Background: Bariatric surgery is essential for treating morbid obesity, requiring nursing staff to have comprehensive knowledge to ensure effective patient care. This study aimed to evaluate the impact of a reference guide on nurses' knowledge and patient satisfaction.

Methods: A quasi-experimental design was used at Mansoura University Hospital, involving 78 nurses and 156 patients. Participants were divided into two groups: 78 patients before and 78 after the guide's implementation. The primary outcome was the improvement in nurses' knowledge and patient satisfaction, measured over a 9-month period. Randomisation and allocation concealment methods were not applicable. Blinding was not implemented.

Results: Post-intervention, nurses with good knowledge increased from 10.3% to 80.8%, and poor self-reported practices decreased from 80.8% to 5.1%. Patient satisfaction significantly improved. No adverse events were reported.

Interpretation: The reference guide significantly enhanced nurses' knowledge and patient satisfaction. Continuous educational programs are recommended to maintain these improvements.

Trial registration: Not provided.

Funding: Not specified.
